page.title: 11HEDGEROWS
page.content: The surrounding boundaries to the fields are usually hedges. These hedges are the main habitats for many varieties of wildlife including hedgehogs,rabbits,mice,birds and insects. These hedges are sometimes very significant,as they mark the terminal boundaries of two farmers' lands. However these hedgerows are a handful for the farmers to keep and many tend to pull them them up and use fences instead,as in many cases in this area.Pulling the hedges down can be very destructive to the wildlife that used to occupy the hedges. The actual countryside is fairly undulating and some hills can be very steep as can be seen when going through Little Hadham.
